Intolerable Weather The flared sun beats its skin-tight drum, and I think how arrogant it is to be alive. The blueberries are cultivating their beards at the ice-domed back of the refrigerator. Whose silence matters moreâ€“yours or mine? We are still, and still breathing, but barely, as the wheat gathers her skirts by the stream. No prosody without blood or sweat, they say. None of us can survive...
